column4: Is there a way to find out what caused my laptop to completely lock up?
I had to hold the power button til it shut off because nothing at all would work.  I was wondering if maybe something would be in a log file.
weird, did you try to network?
I was already connected to a network and I had firefox open but it was idle.
could be a dead X, or cpu overheating
no, can you connect to the machine via network?
I have a laptop cooler with 2 fans blowing on it all the time.
Oh, it's the only computer I have at home so I can't try that.
what were you doing when it happened? standard ubuntu kernel?
It did this last night so I would like to see if it's a bug.
I was listening to music with xmms, had gaim open but idle, firefox open but idle, and one terminal open
Updates were installing and now I can't open the update manager (it installed all but 4)
then, check for hardware problem (memtest86), but still go #ubuntu+1
Alright, nothing would be in a log though?
